_comment: Claude Code settings for {{PROJECT_NAME}}. Customize permissions, hooks, and patterns based on your project's tools and security requirements.

_template_variables.PROJECT_NAME: Replace with your project name (e.g., MeatyPrompts, AcmeApp)
_template_variables.PACKAGE_MANAGER: Replace with your package manager (pnpm, npm, yarn, bun)
_template_variables.PYTHON_TOOL: Replace with Python tooling (uv, poetry, pip)
_template_variables.API_PATH: Replace with your API service path (e.g., services/api, src/server, backend)
_template_variables.LINTER_COMMAND: Replace with your linter command (ruff, pylint, flake8, eslint)
_template_variables.PROJECT_STANDARDS: Replace with your project's core principles

permissions._comment_deny: Dangerous operations that are always blocked. Customize based on your security requirements.
permissions._comment_ask: Operations requiring user confirmation. Customize based on your workflow (e.g., deployments, package installs).
permissions._comment_allow: Always-allowed operations. Customize tools based on your project's package managers and build tools.

PreToolUse._comment: Pre-tool validation hook - runs before Write or Edit operations

PostToolUse._comment: Python linting hook - runs after Write/Edit on .py files. Customize path and linter command. Matcher matches tool names (Write|Edit), command filters by file extension using $TOOL_ARGS.

hooks.command: FILE_PATH=$(echo "$TOOL_ARGS" | jq -r '.file_path // empty' 2>/dev/null) && if [[ -n "$FILE_PATH" && "$FILE_PATH" =~ \.py$ ]]; then echo "Checking Python file: $FILE_PATH" && flake8 "$FILE_PATH" --select=E9,F63,F7,F82 --show-source 2>/dev/null || echo 'Python syntax check complete'; fi

PostToolUse._comment: NotebookLM sync hook - syncs markdown docs to NotebookLM when modified. Logs to ~/.notebooklm/sync.log

SessionStart._comment: Session initialization hook - runs when Claude Code session starts. No matcher needed for SessionStart events.

hooks.command: echo 'SkillMeat development session started â€” follow Python best practices and run tests before commits'
